table-wrap.label: Table 1

tr.td: Prevent clinical illness in individuals ≥9 y
Women of reproductive age Adolescent girls ≥9 y Boys/men of the same age range
Depends on vaccine platform: Neurologic disorders Autoimmune disorders Immunosuppression

list-item.p:
Nonreplicating platforms
•
Inactivate whole virus
•
Subunit-based

tr.td: Single-cycle replicating vectors with robust safety data Live attenuated vaccine or replication competent with safety data
Comparable to WHO-recommended vaccines Low risk of high fever
Tolerable reactogenicity and acceptable safety profile
Meets an established surrogate of immunity in animal models or cohort studies (ie, neutralizing Ab titers in >70% of recipients)
Long-lasting protection of more than 1 y and can be maintained by a single booster dose
Protection lasts at least 1 y and can be maintained by booster doses
Monovalent with documented neutralization of Asian and African lineages
At least 12 mo at −20°C At least 6 mo at 2°-8°C
At least 12 mo at −20°C Stability for 6 h at 2°-8°C
Can be administered with other vaccines with no loss of immunogenicity or safety
Liquid product in single-dose or multidose packages. Maximal volume of 0.5 mL
Lyophilized product in single-dose or multidose packages. Maximal volume of 0.5 mL

fn.p: Ab = antibody; IM = intramuscular; SC = subcutaneous; WHO = World Health Organization; ZIKV = Zika virus.

table-wrap.attrib:
Data from the World Health Organization.
